intro: Viscaria × media f. subvulgaris, commonly known as the common poppy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas and thrives in well-drained soil. It has a short, upright stem with lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This variety is known for its hardy nature and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
